alerts.title: Potential Astroturf Campaign Around ICE and Border Patrol Shootings
alerts.description: Multiple news articles report on protests and events in cities across the US, including Minneapolis, Dallas, Portland, and others, related to ICE and Border Patrol shootings. This, combined with the presence of generic advocacy organizations with similar naming patterns and geographic clustering, suggests a possible coordinated astroturf campaign.

alerts.title: Potential Astroturf Activity around ICE Shooting Protests
alerts.description: Multiple news articles mention protests and rallies in response to the fatal ICE shooting in Minnesota, with similar messaging and organization names across different states. This could indicate a coordinated astroturf campaign to manufacture grassroots activity.

factors.name: News coverage
factors.value: Extensive coverage of protests in multiple states

alerts.title: Potential astroturf activity in multiple states
alerts.description: The data indicates coordinated advocacy campaigns and protests across several US states, with suspicious organization names, geographic clustering, and timing that suggests potential astroturf (manufactured grassroots) activity.

factors.name: States
factors.value: GA, OH, MI, AZ, FL, TX

factors.name: Organizations
factors.value: Citizens For Sanity, Citizens For Education, Citizens For Peace, Lobbyists For Citizens, Case Action Fund, Floridians Protecting Freedom, Michigan Freedom Fund, Texas Freedom Network, Election Freedom Inc, Campaign For Liberty

alerts.title: Potential Astroturf Activity
alerts.description: The data suggests the presence of coordinated messaging campaigns that may be attempting to influence public opinion on issues related to Dallas, Texas, and the well-being of children.

factors.name: Known Patterns
factors.value: The data includes several known patterns associated with advocacy groups, such as 'Keep Dallas Safe', 'Dallas Justice Now', 'Save Texas Kids', 'Protect Texas Kids', and 'Mission DFW'.

factors.name: Recent Alerts
factors.value: The data indicates that there have been 5 recent alerts, which could be related to the observed patterns.

factors.name: Lack of Anomalies and High-Risk Organizations
factors.value: The absence of reported anomalies or high-risk organizations suggests a more coordinated and potentially astroturf-like campaign.

alerts.title: Potential Astroturf Campaign in Dallas
alerts.description: The data shows several known patterns associated with astroturf campaigns targeting the Dallas, Texas area. This may indicate the presence of a coordinated effort to influence public opinion or policy.

factors.name: Known Patterns
factors.value: Keep Dallas Safe, Dallas Justice Now, Save Texas Kids, Protect Texas Kids, Mission DFW

alerts.title: Potential Astroturf Campaign Detected
alerts.description: The data shows several known patterns associated with potential astroturf activity, including groups with names like 'Keep Dallas Safe', 'Dallas Justice Now', 'Save Texas Kids', 'Protect Texas Kids', and 'Mission DFW'.

factors.name: Job Posting Spike
factors.description: Unusual increase in protest-related job listings

factors.name: Pattern Name
factors.description: Organization name matches known astroturf naming patterns

factors.name: Delaware Registration
factors.description: Out-of-state Delaware incorporation for local organization

factors.name: Event Timing
factors.description: Activity correlates with upcoming council vote or hearing

factors.name: Funding Opacity
factors.description: No disclosed funding sources or vague 990 filings
